intro: Althaea plebeia, commonly known as the common marshmallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its showy pink or white flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Althaea plebeia is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
